feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system lacks automated salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation exists.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not the active calculation method. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation causing systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day-counting methods that account for leap years and incomplete service periods.
known_issues.gap_statement: Current calculation method requires manual verification and potential adjustment for edge cases | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential inconsistency in counting leap year days for service duration calculation
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for transparent documentation on how leap year days are handled in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation exists, adding one extra day to total service duration
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days worked calculation needs review to ensure exact service tenure computation

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to policy settings (potentially 30 vs 31 days), causing potential salary amount mismatches.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations that may produce different results.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, particularly for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate deductions when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction.

known_issues.title: Deduction Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), potentially resulting in deductions that exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave. This results in deductions being calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate is recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Rigid salary calculation method that does not flexibly accommodate individual employee attendance variations

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be directly edited.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to control unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amounts are calculated using basic + allowances / 30, but with inconsistent decimal handling that results in slightly lower amounts.
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Monthly Accrual Limits Mid-Month Departures
limitations.limitation_statement: Platform lacks flexible leave accrual handling for mid-month departures, defaulting to monthly accrual that does not prorate or include partial month leave balances
limitations.impact: Requires manual intervention for employees departing mid-month

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are integrated
limitations.impact: Potential minor variations in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: The system uses 366 as a divisor for years containing leap years when calculating partial service periods, which can lead to slight differences in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations for service periods spanning leap years

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is always calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor for daily wage calculation based on policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method Constraints
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Accrual amounts will vary based on the selected configuration method

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may appear different depending on how work week is configured for each employee or organization

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve.

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate retroactive salary deduction recalculation

limitations.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates for February, potentially causing display discrepancies in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion due to incorrect remarks, though actual calculations remain mathematically correct

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually track unpaid leaves and overtime separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Always verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings first; ignore greyed-out formula in leave policy

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation between system and MOHRE reference
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System incorrectly counts 365 days instead of 366 days for leap year

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Pro-rated amounts consistently lower by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system and manual gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Complex calculation involving service duration splitting and different rates for service periods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation by splitting service duration and applying tiered rates (21 days for first 5 years, 30 days for subsequent years)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences between manual and system gratuity calculations

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into segments: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year, with precise day counting for partial years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, with a fixed daily rate divisor that may not match user expectations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual totals across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or use consistent divisor across calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Check work week configuration to understand how working days are defined
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify employee's work week setup to confirm working days calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Salary not prorated correctly for offboarded employees

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary using daily rate: (Monthly Salary / 30) * Days Worked

The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day-counting methods that account for leap years and incomplete service periods.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Days Worked Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to policy settings (potentially 30 vs 31 days), causing potential salary amount mismatches.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating based on actual working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Deduction Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations for unpaid leave. This results in deductions being calculated using a system-wide setting instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be directly edited.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amounts are calculated using basic + allowances / 30, but with inconsistent decimal handling that results in slightly lower amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Accrual Limits Mid-Month Departures
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform lacks flexible leave accrual handling for mid-month departures, defaulting to monthly accrual that does not prorate or include partial month leave balances

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are integrated

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses 366 as a divisor for years containing leap years when calculating partial service periods, which can lead to slight differences in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is always calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor for daily wage calculation based on policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method Constraints
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment daily wage can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation

claims_to_validate.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates for February, potentially causing display discrepancies in leap years.

claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
